Items.Title: Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling upon the Council of the City of New York to support the City's software and information technology industry and to support the "Buy NY" campaign of its trade association, the New York Software Industry Association; all software and information technology buyers and procurers, in private industry, the not-for-profit sector, and all levels of government, to take part in the "Buy NY" campaign by including one or more New York City producers or vendors on all evaluation lists; and all buyers and procurers in the software and information technology field, in private industry, the not-for-profit sector, and all levels of government, to support the Buy NY campaign by meeting New York City vendors and producers at the NYSIA "Buy NY" fair on Friday, March 21, 2003.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted unanimously by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the "Buy NY Campaign"

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and Legislature of New York State to meet their constitutional and statutory duty to provide counsel for indigent defendants by increasing the rates paid to assigned counsel, with no distinction between in-court and out-of-court work, index the assigned counsel rates to inflation, and eliminate the ceiling on total per case compensation, and further calling upon the Governor and Legislature to fully fund the increase in these rates.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted  by voice vote.  The following 2 Council Members formally objected to the passage of this item: Council Members Gallagher and Lanza.  The following 2 Council Members formally abstained from voting on this matter: Council Members Vallone Jr. and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the rates paid to assigned counsel in all cases to $90 per hour, with no distinction between in-court and out-of-court work,

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of IRIS WEINSHALL as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on April 9, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 2301 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of IRIS WEINSHALL as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission to serve for the remainder of a seven-year term that began on February 1, 2003 and will expire on January 31, 2010.

Res. No. ___

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF IRIS WEINSHALL AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY TAXI AND LIMOUSINE COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 3021 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of IRIS WEINSHALL as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission to serve for the remainder of a seven-year term that began on February 1, 2003 and will expire on January 31, 2010.
Items.MatterName: M 506 - Iris Weinshall, Taxi & Limousine Commission

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of  STANLEY ERNEST MICHELS as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on April 9, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 2301 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of STANLEY ERNEST MICHELS as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission to serve for the remainder of a seven-year term that began on February 1, 2003 and will expire on January 31, 2010.

Res. No. ____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF STANLEY ERNEST MICHELS AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY TAXI AND LIMOUSINE COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 3021 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of STANLEY ERNEST MICHELS as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission to serve for the remainder of a seven-year term that began on February 1, 2001 and will expire on January 31, 2008.
Items.MatterName: M 507 - Stanley E. Michels, Taxi & Limousine Commission

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to support the imposition of a Fair Share Commuter Tax/Reverse Commuter Reimbursement Program, which would consist of a commuter tax imposed upon non-New York City residents, as well as an undertaking by the City to effectively reimburse the surrounding suburban New York counties for the City residents who commute to those counties at the same rate as that paid by the suburban county residents who commute to the City.
Items.MatterName: Fair Share Commuter Tax/Reverse Commuter Reimbursement Program

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Governor George Pataki to withdraw a Fiscal Year 2003-2004 budget proposal to cut funding to the City University of New York, and further calling upon the New York State Legislature to reject all Fiscal Year 2003-2004 budget proposals that limit funding for the City University of New York.
Items.MatterName: Governor Pataki to withdraw a FY'03-'04 budget proposal to cut funding to CUNY.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Velella, Golden, Maltese, Marchi, Mendez and Padavan, S.867, and Assembly Members Abbate and McLaughlin, A.3471, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty".
Items.MatterName: Certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty (S.867, A.3471)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Augusta National Golf Club to cease its practice of gender segregation and urging all television networks and other media, particularly CBS Broadcasting, to refrain from broadcasting the Masters in 2004 and future years as long as it is held at Augusta or any other venue that promotes segregation and discrimination.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice vote.  The following 2 Council Members objected to the passage of this item:  Council Members Felder and Lanza.  The following 4 Council Members formally abstained from voting on this matter:  Council Members Gallagher, McMahon, Vallone Jr. and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Condemning the gender segregation practiced by the Augusta National Golf Club.

Items.Title: Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of IRIS WEINSHALL as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, which was referred to on April 9, 2003, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 2301 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of IRIS WEINSHALL as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission to serve for the remainder of a seven-year term that began on February 1, 2003 and will expire on January 31, 2010.

Res. No. ___

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF IRIS WEINSHALL AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY TAXI AND LIMOUSINE COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 3021 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of IRIS WEINSHALL as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission to serve for the remainder of a seven-year term that began on February 1, 2003 and will expire on January 31, 2010.
Items.MatterName: M 506 - Iris Weinshall, Taxi & Limousine Commission
